ns2:Service.description: The caGrid caDSR Grid Service provides access to information in the caDSR that is relevant to caGrid, and has capabilities to generate caGrid standard metadata instances.
ns2:Service.name: CaDSRService

ns2:Operation.description: Returns all Projects registered in caDSR.
ns2:Operation.name: findAllProjects

ns6:UMLClass.description: Project combines together information about conducted research: all used and created samples, data files, procedures. Each project can have multiple procedures and at the same time each procedure can belong to different projects.

ns6:UMLAttribute.description: The preferred anme attribute of the Classification Scheme of type "Project" used to group together the elements in the UML Model Project.
ns6:UMLAttribute.name: shortName

ns6:SemanticMetadata.conceptDefinition: The words or language units by which a thing is known.
Having little (physical) length or seeming to be limited in (temporal) duration.

A database is an information set with a regular structure. Although it can be applied to any set of information the term was invented to refer to computerised data, and is used almost exclusively in computing. (from Wikipedia)
One or more characters used to identify, name, or characterize the nature, properties, or contents of a thing.

ns6:UMLAttribute.description: The version number of the Classification Scheme of type "Project" used to group together elemetns of this UML Model Project.
ns6:UMLAttribute.name: version

ns6:SemanticMetadata.conceptDefinition: Version; something a little different from others of the same type; one of a sequence of copies of a program, each incorporating new modifications.

ns6:UMLAttribute.description: The text representing an unambiguous definition. This is stored as the Classification Scheme definition in caDSR. e.g Classificaiton Scheme of type "Project" definition attribute in caDSR
ns6:UMLAttribute.name: description

ns6:SemanticMetadata.conceptDefinition: Description; a statement that represents something in words.

ns6:UMLAttribute.description: The descriptive name of the Classification Scheme of type "Project" used to group together the elemetns in the UML Model Project.
ns6:UMLAttribute.name: longName

ns6:SemanticMetadata.conceptDefinition: Of relatively great or greater than average spatial extension or temporal duration.
The words or language units by which a thing is known.
Any piece of work that is undertaken or attempted.

ns2:Operation.description: Returns all Projects registered in caDSR under the given context.
ns2:Operation.name: findProjects

ns8:UMLAttribute.name: version

ns8:UMLAttribute.description: The text representing an unambiguous definition. This is stored as the Classification Scheme definition in caDSR. e.g Classificaiton Scheme of type "Project" definition attribute in caDSR
ns8:UMLAttribute.name: description

ns8:SemanticMetadata.conceptDefinition: Description; a statement that represents something in words.

ns8:UMLAttribute.description: The descriptive name of the Classification Scheme of type "Project" used to group together the elemetns in the UML Model Project.
ns8:UMLAttribute.name: longName

ns8:SemanticMetadata.conceptDefinition: Of relatively great or greater than average spatial extension or temporal duration.
The words or language units by which a thing is known.
Any piece of work that is undertaken or attempted.

ns2:Operation.description: Returns all packages in the given Project.
ns2:Operation.name: findPackagesInProject

ns12:UMLAttribute.description: The Classification Scheme Item of type "UMLPakage Name". The descriptonis stored as the CSI description
ns12:UMLAttribute.name: description

ns12:SemanticMetadata.conceptDefinition: Description; a statement that represents something in words.

ns12:UMLAttribute.description: The Classification Scheme Item of type "UML Package Name" is created for each package in a UML Project. This name is stored as the CSI name.
ns12:UMLAttribute.name: name

ns12:SemanticMetadata.conceptDefinition: The words or language units by which a thing is known.
One or more characters used to identify, name, or characterize the nature, properties, or contents of a thing.

A database is an information set with a regular structure. Although it can be applied to any set of information the term was invented to refer to computerised data, and is used almost exclusively in computing. (from Wikipedia)
Data about data; information that describes another set of data.

A non-proprietary, third generation modelling language. The Unified Modeling Language is an open method used to specify, visualise, construct and document the artifacts of an object-oriented software-intensive system under development. The UML represents
Written programs or procedures or rules and associated documentation pertaining to the operation of a computer system and that are stored in read/write memory.

ns2:Fault.description: Thrown if the given Project is null, not valid, or ambiquous.
ns2:Fault.name: InvalidProjectException

ns2:Operation.description: Returns the Classes in the given Project.
ns2:Operation.name: findClassesInProject

ns16:UMLClass.description: caDSR properties of the UML Class in a domain model.

ns16:UMLAttribute.description: The caDSR Object Class definition supplied by the UML Model for a project. The defnition is stores in caDSR as an alternate definiton of type = UML CLASS
ns16:UMLAttribute.name: description

ns16:SemanticMetadata.conceptDefinition: Description; a statement that represents something in words.

A database is an information set with a regular structure. Although it can be applied to any set of information the term was invented to refer to computerised data, and is used almost exclusively in computing. (from Wikipedia)
One or more characters used to identify, name, or characterize the nature, properties, or contents of a thing.

ns16:UMLAttribute.description: The caDSR Object Class alternate name. This is stored in the Alternate Names of type = UML CLASS and is classified by the Project (CS/CSI)
ns16:UMLAttribute.name: fullyQualifiedName

ns16:SemanticMetadata.conceptDefinition: The words or language units by which a thing is known.

A term that helps define and render a concept unique. Criteria that further defines or describes a specific aspect (object class, property, representation) of a Data Element Concept or a Value Domain. (NCICB)
Containing as much or as many as is possible or normal.

ns16:UMLAttribute.description: The Object Class alternate Name type="UML CLASS"
ns16:UMLAttribute.name: name

ns16:SemanticMetadata.conceptDefinition: The words or language units by which a thing is known.
A set of ideas, abstractions, or things in the real world that can be identified with explicit boundaries and meaning and whose properties and behavior follow the same rules. (caBIO)
Data about data; information that describes another set of data.

A non-proprietary, third generation modelling language. The Unified Modeling Language is an open method used to specify, visualise, construct and document the artifacts of an object-oriented software-intensive system under development. The UML represents

Containing as much or as many as is possible or normal.

ns40:UMLAttribute.name: name

A non-proprietary, third generation modelling language. The Unified Modeling Language is an open method used to specify, visualise, construct and document the artifacts of an object-oriented software-intensive system under development. The UML represents

ns42:UMLClass.description: The group of concept codes in a partivular order that are the unambiguous signature of each of the associated with a particular element in the UML Model.

ns42:UMLAttribute.description: A flag that indicates that the concept is the one of the most significance in the semantic signature.
ns42:UMLAttribute.name: isPrimaryConcept

ns42:SemanticMetadata.conceptDefinition: An indicator that can be set or unset in order to signal whether a particular condition is true. The indicator usually takes the form of a single binary digit, or bit (either 0 or 1). (from Dictionary of Computers)
Occurring first in time or sequence; original. (American Heritage Dictionary)

A concept is the basic unit of information contained in the Thesaurus. They describe sets of individuals in a given domain. A concept has a name, belongs to a Namespace and exists in relation to other concepts. The vertical relationships consist of "isa" statements that form a logical hierarchy (taxonomy or subsumption graph). In general, concepts above a given concept are referred to as superconcepts or parents and those below as subconcepts or children. In addition, there are horizontal named realationships between concepts called Roles, binary relations between concepts that provide a machine-interpretable definition of a concept and the means for discrimination of sibling concepts. A concept may also include Properties, named slots that allow attachment of external information to concepts.
One or more characters used to identify, name, or characterize the nature, properties, or contents of a thing.

A database is an information set with a regular structure. Although it can be applied to any set of information the term was invented to refer to computerised data, and is used almost exclusively in computing. (from Wikipedia)

ns42:UMLAttribute.description: The relative position of a group of concepts in the overall ordeing of the concepts in teh semantic sigature. More than one concept can be grouped together with and/or logic to form a single level of qualification fon for the primary concept.
ns42:UMLAttribute.name: orderLevel

ns42:SemanticMetadata.conceptDefinition: A logical or comprehensible arrangement of separate elements.
A position on a scale measuring intensity, quality, or amount. (NCI)

ns42:UMLAttribute.description: The EVS preferred Definition for the concept.
ns42:UMLAttribute.name: conceptDefinition

ns42:SemanticMetadata.conceptDefinition: A concise explanation of the meaning of a word or phrase or symbol.

A concept is the basic unit of information contained in the Thesaurus. They describe sets of individuals in a given domain. A concept has a name, belongs to a Namespace and exists in relation to other concepts. The vertical relationships consist of "isa" statements that form a logical hierarchy (taxonomy or subsumption graph). In general, concepts above a given concept are referred to as superconcepts or parents and those below as subconcepts or children. In addition, there are horizontal named realationships between concepts called Roles, binary relations between concepts that provide a machine-interpretable definition of a concept and the means for discrimination of sibling concepts. A concept may also include Properties, named slots that allow attachment of external information to concepts.

ns42:UMLAttribute.description: The relative position of the concept in the semantic signature for the item.
ns42:UMLAttribute.name: order

ns42:SemanticMetadata.conceptDefinition: A logical or comprehensible arrangement of separate elements.

ns42:UMLAttribute.name: conceptName

ns42:SemanticMetadata.conceptDefinition: The words or language units by which a thing is known.

A concept is the basic unit of information contained in the Thesaurus. They describe sets of individuals in a given domain. A concept has a name, belongs to a Namespace and exists in relation to other concepts. The vertical relationships consist of "isa" statements that form a logical hierarchy (taxonomy or subsumption graph). In general, concepts above a given concept are referred to as superconcepts or parents and those below as subconcepts or children. In addition, there are horizontal named realationships between concepts called Roles, binary relations between concepts that provide a machine-interpretable definition of a concept and the means for discrimination of sibling concepts. A concept may also include Properties, named slots that allow attachment of external information to concepts.

ns48:UMLClass.description: A set of permissible values for a data element.

ns48:UMLAttribute.name: maximumLengthNumber

ns48:SemanticMetadata.conceptDefinition: the largest possible quantity or degree.
The information contained in a data field.
Quantity; how much there is of something that you can measure.

ns48:UMLAttribute.description: An indication of the specific number of digits to be expected to the right of the decimal point in a line of numbers.
ns48:UMLAttribute.name: decimalPlace

ns48:SemanticMetadata.conceptDefinition: An indication of the specific number of digits to be expected to the right of the decimal point in a line of numbers.

ns48:UMLAttribute.description: The words for which the character set is known.
ns48:UMLAttribute.name: characterSetName

ns48:SemanticMetadata.conceptDefinition: The words or language units by which a thing is known.

A defined list of characters recognized by the computer hardware and software. Each character is represented by a number. The ASCII character set, for example, uses the numbers 0 through 127 to represent all English characters as well as special control characters.

ns48:UMLAttribute.description: The lower limit of a range
ns48:UMLAttribute.name: lowValueNumber

ns48:SemanticMetadata.conceptDefinition: Range; the difference between the lowest and highest numerical values.
Lower; the bottom one of two.

ns48:UMLAttribute.description: The minimum number of characters to represent the Data Element value.
ns48:UMLAttribute.name: minimumLengthNumber

ns48:SemanticMetadata.conceptDefinition: The smallest possible quantity.
The information contained in a data field.
Quantity; how much there is of something that you can measure.

ns48:UMLAttribute.description: The upper limit of a range
ns48:UMLAttribute.name: highValueNumber

ns48:SemanticMetadata.conceptDefinition: Approaching or constituting a maximum; the highest point (of something).
Indicates the upper limit permissible for a value.

ns48:UMLAttribute.description: The words by which the datatype for an item is known.
ns48:UMLAttribute.name: datatypeName

ns48:SemanticMetadata.conceptDefinition: The words or language units by which a thing is known.
An indication of the form that a value will have. Examples include string, integer, and character.

ns48:UMLAttribute.description: The name of the actual units in which the associated values are measured. (ISO 11179)
ns48:UMLAttribute.name: UOMName

ns48:SemanticMetadata.conceptDefinition: The words or language units by which a thing is known.
A named quantity in terms of which other quantities are measured or specified used as a standard measurement of same kinds, such as pound or kilogram in measuring weight. (NCI)

ns48:UMLAttribute.description: The words by which a template for the structure of the presentation of the Value(s) is known. (ISO 11179)
ns48:UMLAttribute.name: formatName

ns48:SemanticMetadata.conceptDefinition: The words or language units by which a thing is known.
The organization of information according to preset specifications.
A registry item for which administrative information is recorded in an Administration Record. (ISO 11179)
A set of permissible values for a data element.

The Cancer Therapy Evaluation Program (CTEP) is the program within the Division of Cancer Treatment and Diagnosis (DCTD) of the NCI which plans, assesses, and coordinates all aspects of clinical trials including extramural clinical research programs, internal resources, treatment methods and effectiveness, and compilation and exchange of data as it pertains to the development and evaluation of anticancer agents.
The universe of discourse that surrounds a language unit and helps to determine its interpretation.

ns2:Fault.description: Thrown if the given Project is null, not valid, or ambiquous.
ns2:Fault.name: InvalidProjectException

ns67:SemanticMetadata.conceptDefinition: A service available on a system that coordinates resources that are not subject to central control, using open, general purpose protocols and interfaces to deliver nontrivial qualities of services.

ns68:SemanticMetadata.conceptDefinition: Services that are needed to maintain the running of a grid, including monitoring and discovery service, security management service (authentication and authorization), identifier naming and resolution service, query and federated query service, and workflow management service.
